domain.gamecontroller

Class gameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.gamecontroller.gameController

  • public class gameController
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class gameController. Which is the first element of the domain structure beyond GUI. It is a Controller. It connects the every piece of the game to each other. GUI communicates directly and only to this class to make appropriate changes in the game state. This class communicates to all other domain classes according to the message that it takes from the GUI.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      gameController()
      Instantiates a new game controller object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • gameController

        public gameController()
        Instantiates a new game controller object. It is an empty constructor

    • Method Detail

      • rollDice

        public void rollDice()
        Roll the dices. Starts a new turn by moving the player to the new location based on the dices.
        Effects:
        Calls the rollDice() method of the Board object. Then moves the player to the new location. Maintains the flow of the game. Checks if there is a rent that should be paid.

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(java.lang.String playerName,
                      java.awt.Color playerColor)
        Adds a player Player to the game.
        Parameters:
        playerName - the name of the player
        playerColor - the color of the player
        Effects:
        When addPlayer message is received from the GUI by the controller, controller calls the addPlayer method of the Board.

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        Gets the current player.
        Returns:
        the current player
        Effects:
        Returns the current player by calling the getPlayers() and getTurn() methods of the Board object.

      • getCurrentSquare

        public domain.square.Square getCurrentSquare()
        Gets the square that the current players is on.
        Returns:
        the square that the current player is on
        Effects:
        Returns the current square by calling the getSquares() of the Board object. Also uses getCurrentPlayer() method of the gameController object.

      • nextTurn

        public void nextTurn()
        Set the game's state to next turn.
        Effects:
        Calls the nextTurn() method of the Board class. Then updates GameStateHolder to temporarily save game state.

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle(java.util.List<domain.cards.Card> cards)
        Shuffle the cards that are on the board.
        Parameters:
        cards - the cards list that will be shuffled
        Modifies:
        cards: List Cards
        Effects:
        Shuffles the given input cards list.

      • getActionResponse

        public void getActionResponse(Player player)
        Gets the action response.
        Parameters:
        player - the player

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves the current player to the new location.
        Effects:
        Moves the current player to the new location by using the move() method of the Player class.

      • buyProperty

        public void buyProperty()
        Current player buys the property that the player is currently on.
        Effects:
        Calls the buyProperty method of the Player class for the currentPlayer object.

      • removeDeadPlayer

        public void removeDeadPlayer(Player player)
        Removes the dead player from the game.
        Parameters:
        player - the player that will be removed from the dead since the player is so-called dead.
        Modifies:
        Players list of the Board class.
        Effects:
        Removes the Player object from the players List Player of the Board object.

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Start the game by initializing board by calling getInstance() method of the board Board object.
        Modifies:
        board field of gameController object
        Effects:
        Calls a singleton board Board object at the start of the game, to initialize once and for all.

      • startSavedGame

        public void startSavedGame(GameStateHolder data)
        Starts saved game.
        Parameters:
        data - the GameStateHolder object that holds the necessary information to start the game.
        Effects:
        Start the game from the information of the saved game.

      • LoadGame

        public void LoadGame(java.lang.String fileName)
        Load the game.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the save file
        Effects:
        Calls the loadGame method of saveLoad class.

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame()
        Save game.
        Modifies:
        stateHolder object.
        Effects:
        Updates the stateHolder object then saves the game by using saveGame() method of the saveLoad object.

      • numberOfPlayer

        public int numberOfPlayer()
        Gets the number of alive players.
        Returns:
        number of players as an integer.
        Effects:
        Calls the getNumPlayers() method of the board object.

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
        Gets the players list.
        Returns:
        players list
        Effects:
        Calls the getPlayers() method of the board object.
